info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland, southwestern Gaston and northwestern York Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Gastonia, or near Kings Mountain, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Kings Mountain, Bessemer City, South Gastonia, Clover, Crowders Mountain State Park, Kings Mountain State Park, Crowders and Bethany. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
